title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: The system should provide a dialog box with the message 'Do you want to save your file?', with options to choose 'Yes', 'No', or 'Cancel' which halts the shutdown.
SR:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Verify that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu, select the 'Shut Down' command to shut down/reboot the computer.
5. Verify that a dialog box appears asking 'Do you want to save your file?' with options to choose 'Yes', 'No', or 'Cancel' which halts the shutdown.
